p: The estimate of the latent period of infected hosts (1/ ϵ) was drawn from a Gamma distribution with a mean of 3.7 days and a standard deviation of 0.9 days (corresponding to 16 latent stages). This is similar to what has been done by Backer & Nodelijk [ 12] and considering that the latent period in zebra would be similar to what was recorded experimentally from five unvaccinated challenged horses [ 20– 22]. This is however consistent with infection outcomes from seven experimentally challenged plains zebra [ 18] showing that virus isolation from blood yielded positive results on day four.
